questions.question: Which tool from the module helps you project taxes owed at different income levels?
questions.explanation: The ladder worksheet illustrates how additional dollars are taxed across brackets.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of bunching charitable contributions into a single tax year?
options: Unlocking itemized deductions above the standard deduction
Qualifying for foreign earned income exclusions
questions.explanation: Bunching lets you exceed the standard deduction and claim a larger deduction in the contribution year.

questions.question: Health Savings Account contributions are triple tax advantaged when used for qualified medical expenses.
questions.explanation: Contributions are deductible, growth is tax-free, and qualified withdrawals are untaxed.

questions.question: Which recordkeeping habit prevents validation delays during an IRS audit?
options: Keeping digital copies of receipts organized by category
questions.explanation: Organized digital records support deductions and credits if the IRS requests documentation.

questions.question: Qualified dividend income is generally taxed at...
questions.explanation: Qualified dividends receive favorable long-term capital gains treatment.

questions.question: Which tactic can offset realized capital gains with capital losses?
questions.explanation: Tax-loss harvesting sells losing positions to cancel out gains, reducing taxable income.

questions.question: Filing estimated quarterly taxes can help self-employed professionals avoid penalties.
questions.explanation: Quarterly payments keep you within IRS safe harbor thresholds.

questions.question: When planning Roth conversions, which factor is most critical?
options: Current versus future marginal tax rates
questions.explanation: Conversions make sense when you expect to pay lower taxes now than in retirement.

questions.question: Which deduction phase-out should high earners watch when contributing to traditional IRAs?
questions.explanation: Traditional IRA deductibility phases out at certain income thresholds if covered by a workplace plan.

questions.question: Which schedule do rental property owners use to claim depreciation?
questions.explanation: Schedule E reports passive rental income, expenses, and depreciation.
